main event: A civilian observed an oval and very thin object flying at a 45 degree tilt while driving in his automobile on 4 June 1949.
interesting points: The object was flying parallel to Old Brownsville Road from northwest to southeast at about twice the speed of conventional aircraft., The object maintained a straight and level flight until obscured by trees, and made no sound., The object's size was comparable to the wingspread of a two-engine plane, with a thickness of only 10% of its diameter., The observer was well-educated and respected in his community, further supporting the credibility of the sighting., Weather reports from nearby airports confirmed visibility and conditions suited for such an observation.
sighted object: an oval and very thin object
witness description: a Chief Engineer at Pittsburgh Coal Washer Co., well-educated and level-headed
